articles.author: Flora Graham
articles.title: Daily briefing: This is what happens to a penny on Mars
articles.description: It gets dusty. Plus: the IPCC climate change report in the form of emojis and supercharged crime-scene DNA analysis.
articles.content: Hello Nature readers, welcome to your essential daily briefing of science news. The long reach of law enforcement could now extend into our DNA. Credit: Rick Bowmer/AP/Shutterstock It could soon be possible to search crime-scene DNA for links to nearly all pe… [+5855 chars]

articles.author: Alexandra Witze
articles.title: Double the fun: Mars scientists push NASA to send rock-harvesting rover to two sites
articles.description: The US$2.4-billion mission aims to collect the first samples for return from the red planet.
articles.content: Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech/MSSS/JHU-APL NASAs next Mars rover the first to gather rock samples meant to come back to Earth should dream big and visit as many different places on the red planet as possible, scientists concluded on 18 October. That would probably… [+5313 chars]

articles.author: Richard Speed
articles.title: The 'roid in Spain drills mainly on the plain: Plucky Brit Mars robot laps up sun, sand and, er, simulated science
articles.description: Scientists watch from 1,000 miles away as Charlie the Rover plays with ExoMars' toys A prototype Mars rover, named Charlie, has gone for a trundle around Spain’s Tabernas Desert this week, as scientists gear up for the real thing in 2021.…
articles.content: A prototype Mars rover, named Charlie, has gone for a trundle around Spains Tabernas Desert this week, as scientists gear up for the real thing in 2021. The UK-built trundlebot was controlled by the ExoFiT team at the UKs Harwell Space Cluster in Oxfordshire,… [+3287 chars]

articles.title: Surviving Mars’s Space Race expansion brings rivalries to the red planet

articles.author: Matthew Warren, Nature magazine
articles.title: Mission Math: Which Planets Do Space Scientists Love Most--and Least?
articles.description: As BepiColombo heads to long-neglected Mercury, a look at which planets attract scientific missions, and why -- Read more on ScientificAmerican.com
articles.content: Last week, the BepiColombo spacecraft successfully began its seven-year journey to Mercury—only the third-ever mission sent to the planet. The day before, scientists said that NASA’s next Mars rover —intended to be first to gather and return rock samples to E… [+3976 chars]

articles.title: Mars 2020 parachute is a 'go'
articles.description: In the early hours of Sept. 7, NASA broke a world record.
articles.content: This high-definition image was taken on Sept. 7, 2018, during the third and final test flight of the ASPIRE payload. It was the fastest inflation of this size parachute in history and created a peak load of almost 70,000 pounds of force. Credit: NASA/JPL-Calt… [+3129 chars]

articles.author: Hannah Jane Parkinson
articles.title: From Cat Power to Coldplay: the best, worst and weirdest Rihanna covers
articles.description: The Last Shadow Puppets turned vampiric, Harry Styles harked back to prog rock and Patti Smith was overcome by nerves … How 15 acts laid down their love for the queen of R&B Continuing her run of sublime cover versions (there have been two albums of them), th…
articles.content: C ontinuing her run of sublime cover versions (there have been two albums of them), the second single from Chan Marshall AKA Cat Power s new album, Wanderer, is a subtle, reworked version of Rihannas Stay. Marshall first heard the song in an ex-boyfriends car… [+6232 chars]

articles.author: Meghan Bartels
articles.title: Where to Land on the Red Planet? That's the Choice for Mars 2020 Rover Team.
articles.description: NASA's next Mars spacecraft will soon know its landing site, as scientists meet to debate the relative merits of four final contenders. The mission will investigate whether the Red Planet ever hosted life.
articles.content: NASA's next Mars spacecraft will soon know its landing site, as scientists meet to debate the relative merits of four final contenders. The mission will investigate whether the Red Planet ever hosted life. That meeting, taking place in California, gathers hun… [+2055 chars]

articles.author: Annie Gasparro
articles.title: Food Scientists Are Getting Fed Up with Picky Eaters
articles.description: Cyanocobalamin is just another word for vitamin B12. Xanthan gum is a safe way to stabilize sauces. But try telling that to consumers.
articles.content: First they came for the trans fat, and pretty much everyone agreed it should be banned, because it can clog arteries. Then they came for monosodium glutamate. Even though food companies say it is harmless, they eventually pulled it from many products, because… [+6093 chars]

articles.author: Jeff Foust
articles.title: NASA to Soon End Active Efforts to Restore Contact with Opportunity
articles.description: NASA expects to soon end efforts to contact the Opportunity Mars rover, silent for more than four months after a major dust storm, but will continue to listen for signals from the spacecraft for months to come.
articles.content: KNOXVILLE, Tenn. — NASA expects to soon end efforts to contact the Opportunity Mars rover, silent for more than four months after a major dust storm, but will continue to listen for signals from the spacecraft for months to come. Opportunity, which has been o… [+3569 chars]

articles.author: Ben Travers
articles.title: Hulu’s ‘The First’ Stars Sean Penn, But Beau Willimon’s Drama Is Far From a One-Man Show
articles.description: Even with an Oscar-winning star, the "House of Cards" showrunner wanted many perspectives to tell his story tracking the first manned mission to Mars.
articles.content: When Beau Willimon was a kid, his father would leave home for up to five months at a time. Henry Willimon was a captain in the U.S. Navy and worked as an engineer on nuclear subs. For those long stretches at sea, he couldn’t even send messages home. “One of m… [+5835 chars]
